cards.title: Refactor User Authentication to Use Async/Await
cards.description:
Simple refactoring task to modernize the user authentication module:

- Replace callback-based authentication with async/await pattern
- Update function signatures to use async def
- Ensure all database calls use await
- Update tests to handle async functions

cards.title: Build Real-Time WebSocket Chat Service with Redis Pub/Sub
cards.description:
Build a comprehensive real-time chat service with the following requirements:
    
- WebSocket-based real-time communication
- Redis Pub/Sub for message distribution across multiple server instances
- User authentication and session management
- Message persistence in PostgreSQL database
- Message history retrieval with pagination
- Typing indicators and read receipts
- File upload support (images, documents)
- Rate limiting and spam prevention
- End-to-end encryption for private messages
- Admin dashboard for monitoring active connections
- Support for chat rooms and direct messages
- Notification system for offline users

cards.title: Create Jupyter Notebook Demo of Artemis Features
cards.description:
Create a comprehensive Jupyter notebook that demonstrates Artemis and its features as a slide-based presentation.

Requirements:
- Use Jupyter notebook with slide capabilities (nbconvert)
- Create a professional slide deck showcasing Artemis
- Include sections for:
  1. Introduction to Artemis
  2. Core Architecture (Supervisor, Stages, Orchestrator)
  3. Intelligent Router with Advanced Features
  4. Thermodynamic Computing (uncertainty quantification)
  5. Dynamic Pipeline (runtime adaptability)
  6. Two-Pass Pipeline (fast feedback + refinement)
  7. Hybrid AI Approach (cost optimization)
  8. Live demo with code examples
  9. Real metrics and visualizations
  10. Conclusion and Q&A

- Use examples from .artemis_data/developer_output/developer-b/notebooks as templates
- Include Chart.js or matplotlib visualizations
- Show actual code examples that run
- Include performance metrics
- Make it presentation-ready (slides mode)
- Add speaker notes where appropriate
- Ensure all code cells execute successfully
- Include visual diagrams where helpful

Output:
- artemis_feature_demo.ipynb in the project root
- Should be ready to present with: jupyter nbconvert --to slides --post serve artemis_feature_demo.ipynb

cards.title: Load and Analyze Pipeline Execution Data
cards.description: The Artemis Pipeline Performance Analysis aims to evaluate pipeline execution metrics and create visualizations to enhance understanding of performance trends and efficiency. The project focuses on analyzing data to identify bottlenecks and provide optimization recommendations.
